tv.ouya.console.api

Class OuyaController

  • java.lang.Object
    • tv.ouya.console.api.OuyaController

  • public class OuyaController
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class that contains codes for console buttons and axes.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  OuyaController.ButtonData
      The drawable & displayable name for a specific button.

      • BUTTON_L2

        @Deprecated
public static final int BUTTON_L2
        Deprecated. This code is unreliable on some controller firmwares. Use of analog axis value is recommended.
        Code for the left trigger button. Considered pressed when AXIS_L2 > 0.5
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public static void init(android.content.Context context)

      • getButtonData

        public static OuyaController.ButtonData getButtonData(int ouyaButton)
        Queries the OUYA framework to get the appropriate image/name for a specific button. The returned drawable will be 160px high.
        Parameters:
        ouyaButton - -- the key code to get the image/name for (OuyaController.BUTTON_O, etc)
        Returns:
        A ButtonData structure with the button's drawable/name. The drawable/name can be null if no data was found for the specified button

      • getControllerByDeviceId

        public static OuyaController getControllerByDeviceId(int deviceId)
        Get the current state of a controller

      • getPlayerNumByDeviceId

        public static int getPlayerNumByDeviceId(int deviceId)
        Get the player number for a specific device, in the range [0, MAX_CONTROLLERS), or -1 if no player found.

      • getControllerByPlayer

        public static OuyaController getControllerByPlayer(int playerNum)
        Get the controller for a specific player number

      • onGenericMotionEvent

        public static boolean onGenericMotionEvent(android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Called by the application to update the controller state

      • onKeyDown

        public static boolean onKeyDown(int keyCode,
                android.view.KeyEvent event)
        Called by the application to update the controller state

      • onKeyUp

        public static boolean onKeyUp(int keyCode,
              android.view.KeyEvent event)
        Called by the application to update the controller state

      • startOfFrame

        public static void startOfFrame()
        Signals the start of a new frame loop. Used to reset the "button changed this frame" logic.

      • showCursor

        public static void showCursor(boolean showCursor)
        Allows games to show/hide the mouse cursor.
        Parameters:
        showCursor - True if the cursor should be hidden.

      • setCursorBitmap

        public static void setCursorBitmap(android.graphics.Bitmap bitmap,
                   float hotSpotX,
                   float hotSpotY)
        Allows games to set a custom mouse cursor.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The bitmap to use as the mouse cursor, use null to return to the default cursor.
        hotSpotX - The hotspot's X coordinate, must be in the range [0, bitmap.getWidth) (unless bitmap is null)
        hotSpotY - The hotspot's Y coordinate, must be in the range [0, bitmap.getHeight) (unless bitmap is null)

      • buttonChangedThisFrame

        public boolean buttonChangedThisFrame(int ouyaButton)
        Checks if a button state changed within the current frame loop (as signaled by calling startOfFrame).
        Returns:
        True if the button state changed this frame

      • buttonPressedThisFrame

        public boolean buttonPressedThisFrame(int ouyaButton)

      • buttonReleasedThisFrame

        public boolean buttonReleasedThisFrame(int ouyaButton)

      • getDevice

        public android.view.InputDevice getDevice()
        Returns:
        The device for this controller

      • getDeviceName

        public java.lang.String getDeviceName()
        Returns:
        The name of this device (preferring Bluetooth Device name over Input Device name).

      • getDeviceId

        public int getDeviceId()
        Returns:
        The deviceId for this controller

      • getAxisValue

        public float getAxisValue(int ouyaAxis)
        Returns:
        The current axis value

      • getButton

        public boolean getButton(int ouyaButton)
        Returns:
        The current button state

      • getPlayerNum

        public int getPlayerNum()
        Returns:
        The player number associated with this controller, in the range [0, MAX_CONTROLLERS)
